Package com.taco.suit_lady.util._new.functional

Interface SelfValidatable

All Known Implementing Classes:
ValueGroup
public interface SelfValidatable

Contains a single method, isValid(boolean), that checks if the contents of the SelfValidatable are valid.

The primary purpose of isValid(boolean) is to make it easier to identify bugs caused by a corrupt or otherwise improperly-constructed object.

For example, the following might cause an object instance to be invalid:

  1. An object that is accessed asynchronously but does not have synchronization implemented properly (or at all).
  2. An object with dependencies that were incorrectly injected via Spring.
  3. An object that has specific rules that are mistakenly broken by a future change.
    For Example:
    The ValueGroup class requires both internal arrays â€” values and keys â€” to be of the same length.
    If a future change makes it possible for the internal arrays to have different lengths, any ValueGroup instance that is created as such will be flagged as invalid.

  • Method Details

    • isValid

      boolean isValid​(boolean throwException)

      Checks if this SelfValidatable is valid.

      See above for details.

      Parameters:
      throwException - True if a detailed Exception should be thrown if this SelfValidatable is invalid, false if it should follow through with a return value depicting the validity instead.
      Returns:
      True if this SelfValidatable is valid, false if it is not.
